New Records: Max Schuemann and Lawrence Butler each hit a two-run homer in the seventh inning
Zack Gelof added a solo shot in the eighth
Mason Miller hung on after giving up two runs and four hits in a shaky ninth for his 22nd save
Key Match Events: The Athletics scored three late homers to come back after being quiet through six innings
The game was turned in the seventh and eighth innings with key home runs
Oakland had one hit and trailed 1-0 through six innings, but rallies to win
Pre-Game Insights: The Reds were dealing with five starting pitchers on the injured list, forcing deep bullpen usage
Jakob Junis made his fourth start of the season, retiring all 12 batters he faced with three strikeouts
Reds manager David Bell noted Junis's strong performance setting up the team for a chance to win
Post-Match Reflections: Athletics manager Mark Kotsay highlighted the come-from-behind win as a positive sign for the team
Cincinnati SS Elly De La Cruz became the 5th player since 1901 with 20 homers and 60 stolen bases in a season
Miscellaneous Highlights: Athletics had 162 home runs, tied with the Minnesota Twins for seventh in the majors
Reds had not announced a scheduled starter for the next game
Oakland was leading 5-2 with one out in the ninth when Cincinnati scored twice
Athletics' Tyler Soderstrom was starting to hit and could begin a rehab assignment this week
